intro: Bumelia ekmaniana, commonly known as the Mexican buckthorn, is a small evergreen shrub native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical or ovate in shape. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Bumelia ekmaniana is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
